metadata.Title: CVE-2022-39423 on Ubuntu 20.04 FIPS Compliant (focal) - medium
metadata.Description:
Vulnerability in the Oracle VM VirtualBox product of Oracle Virtualization(component: Core). Supported versions that are affected are Prior to6.1.38. Easily exploitable vulnerability allows high privileged attackerwith logon to the infrastructure where Oracle VM VirtualBox executes tocompromise Oracle VM VirtualBox. While the vulnerability is in Oracle VMVirtualBox, attacks may significantly impact additional products (scopechange). Successful attacks of this vulnerability can result inunauthorized access to critical data or complete access to all Oracle VMVirtualBox accessible data. CVSS 3.1 Base Score 6.0 (Confidentialityimpacts). CVSS Vector: (CVSS:3.1/AV:L/AC:L/PR:H/UI:N/S:C/C:H/I:N/A:N).

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2022-39423` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

virtualbox - 6.1.38-dfsg-3~ubuntu1.20.04.1
virtualbox-dkms - 6.1.38-dfsg-3~ubuntu1.20.04.1
virtualbox-guest-dkms - 6.1.38-dfsg-3~ubuntu1.20.04.1
virtualbox-guest-source - 6.1.38-dfsg-3~ubuntu1.20.04.1
virtualbox-guest-utils - 6.1.38-dfsg-3~ubuntu1.20.04.1
virtualbox-guest-x11 - 6.1.38-dfsg-3~ubuntu1.20.04.1
virtualbox-qt - 6.1.38-dfsg-3~ubuntu1.20.04.1
virtualbox-source - 6.1.38-dfsg-3~ubuntu1.20.04.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: virtualbox package in focal, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '6.1.38-dfsg-3~ubuntu1.20.04.1').
